question: What caused the walls of Jericho to fall?
choices: The Israelites marched around it and shouted
explanation: After marching around Jericho for seven days, the walls fell when the people shouted and the trumpets sounded.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: Who killed Goliath with a sling and a stone?
explanation: Young David defeated the giant Goliath with a single stone from his sling, striking him in the forehead.

verses.kjv:
And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang
it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.

question: Who defeated the Philistines with a donkey's jawbone?
explanation: Samson found a fresh jawbone of a donkey and struck down a thousand Philistines with it.

verses.kjv: And he found a new jawbone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and slew a thousand men therewith.

question: Which city's conquest was Israel's first victory in the Promised Land?
explanation: Jericho was the first city conquered by Israel when they entered the Promised Land.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: What happened to the army of the Egyptians pursuing Israel through the Red Sea?
explanation: The waters returned and covered the chariots and horsemen of Pharaoh's army; not one of them survived.

verses.kjv:
And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen,
and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.

question: Who led a successful night raid against the Midianites with only 300 men?
explanation: Gideon divided his 300 men and attacked at night with torches and trumpets, routing the Midianites.

verses.kjv:
And he divided the three hundred men
into three companies, and he put a trumpet in every man’s hand, with empty pitchers, and lamps within the pitchers.
And he said unto them, Look on me, and do likewise: and, behold, when I come to the outside of the camp, it shall be
that, as I do, so shall ye do.
When I blow with a trumpet, I and all that
are with me, then blow ye the trumpets also on every side of all the camp, and say,
The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.
So Gideon, and the hundred men that
were with him, came unto the outside of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch; and they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers that
were in their hands.
And the three companies blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers, and held the lamps in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands to blow
withal: and they cried, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.
And they stood every man in his place round about the camp: and all the host ran, and cried, and fled.
And the three hundred blew the trumpets, and the LORD set every man’s sword against his fellow, even throughout all the host: and the host fled to Beth-shittah in Zererath,
and to the border of Abel-meholah, unto Tabbath.

question: What did Joshua command to stand still during battle?
explanation: Joshua commanded the sun to stand still over Gibeon and the moon over the Valley of Aijalon.

verses.kjv:
Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.
And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies.
Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.

question: Who conquered Jerusalem and made it the capital of Israel?
explanation: David captured the fortress of Zion (Jerusalem) from the Jebusites and made it his capital.

verses.kjv:
Nevertheless David took the strong hold of Zion: the same
is
 the city of David.

question: What brought down the walls of Jericho?
explanation: When the trumpets sounded and the people shouted, the wall collapsed and Israel took the city.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: What happened to the army chasing the Israelites at the Red Sea?
explanation: The water flowed back and covered the chariots and horsemen. Not one of them survived.

verses.kjv:
And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen,
and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.

question: Who killed Goliath?
explanation: So David triumphed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone.

verses.kjv:
So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but
there was no sword in the hand of David.

question: How many times did the Israelites march around Jericho on the seventh day?
explanation: On the seventh day, they marched around the city seven times, then shouted and the walls fell down.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early about the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on that day they compassed the city seven times.

question: Which judge defeated the Midianites with only 300 men?
explanation: God reduced Gideon's army to 300 men who defeated the Midianites with trumpets, torches, and jars.

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thine hand: and let all the
other people go every man unto his place.

question: Who killed 1,000 men with the jawbone of a donkey?
explanation: Samson found a fresh jawbone of a donkey and struck down a thousand men with it.

verses.kjv: And he found a new jawbone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and slew a thousand men therewith.

question: What did Samson use to kill 1,000 Philistines?
explanation: Finding a fresh jawbone of a donkey, he grabbed it and struck down a thousand men.

verses.kjv: And he found a new jawbone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and slew a thousand men therewith.

question: Who defeated the Midianites with only 300 men?
explanation: The Lord said to Gideon, 'With the three hundred men that lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hands.'

verses.kjv:
And the LORD said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thine hand: and let all the
other people go every man unto his place.

question: Which city's walls fell after the Israelites marched around it?
explanation: When the trumpets sounded, the army shouted, and at the sound of the trumpet, the wall collapsed.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: Who led the Israelites into the Promised Land?
explanation: After the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses' aide: 'Now then, you and all these people, get ready to cross the Jordan River into the land I am about to give to them.'

verses.kjv:
Now after the death of Moses the servant of the LORD it came to pass, that the LORD spake unto Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ minister, saying,
Moses my servant is dead; now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, thou, and all this people, unto the land which I do give to them,
even
 to the children of Israel.

question: How did David kill Goliath?
explanation: Reaching into his bag and taking out a stone, he slung it and struck the Philistine on the forehead.

verses.kjv:
And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang
it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.

question: How many Philistines did Samson kill with the jawbone of a donkey?
explanation: Finding a fresh jawbone of a donkey, he grabbed it and struck down a thousand men.

verses.kjv: And he found a new jawbone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and slew a thousand men therewith.

question: Who betrayed Samson?
explanation: When Delilah saw that he had told her everything, she sent word to the rulers of the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines, saying, Come up this once, for he hath shewed me all his heart. Then the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and brought money in their hand.

question: What was the source of Samson's strength?
explanation: 'No razor has ever been used on my head,' he said, 'because I have been a Nazirite dedicated to God from my mother's womb. If my head were shaved, my strength would leave me.'

verses.kjv:
That he told her all his heart, and said unto her. There hath not come a razor upon mine head; for I
have been a Nazarite unto God from my mother’s womb: if I be shaven, then my strength will go from me, and I shall become weak, and be like any
other man.

question: How did Samson die?
choices: He pushed down the pillars of a temple
explanation: Samson said, 'Let me die with the Philistines!' Then he pushed with all his might, and down came the temple on the rulers and all the people in it.

verses.kjv:
And Samson said, Let me die with the Philistines. And he bowed himself with
all his might; and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that
were therein. So the dead which he slew at his death were more than
they which he slew in his life.

question: What did Joshua command to stand still?
explanation: On the day the Lord gave the Amorites over to Israel, Joshua said, 'Sun, stand still over Gibeon, and you, moon, over the Valley of Aijalon.'

verses.kjv: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.

question: What weapon did David use to defeat Goliath?
explanation: David took a stone, slung it, and struck the Philistine on his forehead. The stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the ground.

verses.kjv:
And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang
it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.
So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but
there was no sword in the hand of David.

question: Which city's walls fell down after the Israelites marched around it?
explanation: When the trumpets sounded, the army shouted, and at the sound of the trumpet, when the men gave a loud shout, the wall collapsed.

verses.kjv:
So the people shouted when
the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

question: When Israel fought Amalek at Rephidim, what happened when Moses held up his hand (Exodus 17:11)?
explanation: Exodus 17:11 says that when Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed; when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, that Amalek prevailed.

question: What did Moses build after the LORD defeated Amalek (Exodus 17:15)?
explanation: Exodus 17:15 says Moses built an altar after the victory.

verses.kjv: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovahnissi:

question: In the battle with Jericho, what did Joshua command the people to do while marching (Joshua 6:10)?
explanation: Joshua 6:10 says Joshua commanded the people not to shout or make any noise with their voice until told to shout.

verses.kjv: And Joshua had commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor make any noise with your voice, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth, until the day I bid you shout; then shall ye shout.

question: How many days were the Israelites told to march around Jericho once each day (Joshua 6:3)?
explanation: Joshua 6:3 instructs Israel to compass the city once each day for six days.

verses.kjv: And ye shall compass the city, all ye men of war, and go round about the city once. Thus shalt thou do six days.

question: When Jael killed Sisera, what did she use (Judges 4:21)?
choices: A nail of the tent and a hammer
explanation: Judges 4:21 says Jael took a nail of the tent and drove it into Sisera's temples with a hammer.

verses.kjv: Then Jael Heber's wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.

question: What did Barak do when Deborah told him the LORD had delivered Sisera into his hand (Judges 4:14)?
choices: He went down from mount Tabor with ten thousand men
He returned home and refused to fight
He waited seven days for reinforcements
He sent messengers to make peace with Sisera
explanation: Judges 4:14 says Barak went down from mount Tabor with ten thousand men after Deborah said the LORD had gone out before him.

verses.kjv: And Deborah said unto Barak, Up; for this is the day in which the LORD hath delivered Sisera into thine hand: is not the LORD gone out before thee? So Barak went down from mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him.

question: What did the men of Judah use when they attacked Adoni-bezek (Judges 1:6)?
choices: They pursued after him and caught him
They trapped him in a net
They drowned him in a river
explanation: Judges 1:6 says they pursued after Adoni-bezek and caught him.

verses.kjv: But Adoni-bezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

question: What did the LORD do to Sisera and his chariots in the battle against Deborah and Barak (Judges 4:15)?
choices: Discomfited Sisera and all his chariots with the edge of the sword
Sent fire from heaven to burn the chariots
Caused the chariots to sink into the sea
Turned Sisera's army against itself immediately
explanation: Judges 4:15 says the LORD discomfited Sisera and all his chariots and all his host with the edge of the sword before Barak.

verses.kjv: And the LORD discomfited Sisera, and all his chariots, and all his host, with the edge of the sword before Barak; so that Sisera lighted down off his chariot, and fled away on his feet.

question: When the Philistines captured the ark, what did they call its place in the house of Dagon (1 Samuel 5:2)?
explanation: 1 Samuel 5:2 says they brought the ark into the house of Dagon and set it by Dagon.

verses.kjv: When the Philistines took the ark of God, they brought it into the house of Dagon, and set it by Dagon.

question: What happened to Dagon when the Philistines rose early the next day after placing the ark by him (1 Samuel 5:3)?
choices: He fell on his face to the ground before the ark of the LORD
He spoke and warned the Philistines
explanation: 1 Samuel 5:3 says Dagon was fallen upon his face to the ground before the ark of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when they of Ashdod arose early on the morrow, behold, Dagon was fallen upon his face to the ground before the ark of the LORD. And they took Dagon, and set him in his place again.

question: What did the Israelites shout when Goliath came out morning and evening (1 Samuel 17:24)?
choices: They fled from him and were sore afraid
They ran to him to fight at once
They sang a song of victory
explanation: 1 Samuel 17:24 says all the men of Israel fled from Goliath and were very afraid.

verses.kjv: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.

question: When Saul armed David, what did David do with the armor after trying it (1 Samuel 17:39)?
choices: He kept it and went to battle
He buried it in the ground
explanation: 1 Samuel 17:39 says David tried Saul's armor and then put it off because he had not proved it.

verses.kjv: And David girded his sword upon his armour, and he assayed to go; for he had not proved it. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.

question: After David defeated Goliath, what did he take from him (1 Samuel 17:54)?
explanation: 1 Samuel 17:54 says David took the Philistine's head and brought it to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armour in his tent.

question: What did Abigail say the LORD had kept David from doing regarding Nabal (1 Samuel 25:26)?
choices: Coming to shed blood and avenging himself with his own hand
explanation: 1 Samuel 25:26 says Abigail told David the LORD had withheld him from coming to shed blood and from avenging himself with his own hand.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD liveth, and as thy soul liveth, seeing the LORD hath withholden thee from coming to shed blood, and from avenging thyself with thine own hand, now let thine enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as Nabal.

question: When Jehoshaphat sent men to teach in Judah, what did they carry with them (2 Chronicles 17:9)?
choices: The book of the law of the LORD
explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:9 says they had the book of the law of the LORD with them and taught in Judah.

verses.kjv: And they taught in Judah, and had the book of the law of the LORD with them, and went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught the people.

question: What did Jehoshaphat set throughout all the fenced cities of Judah (2 Chronicles 17:19)?
explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:19 states that Jehoshaphat set garrisons in Judah’s fenced cities and in Ephraim’s cities which Asa took.

verses.kjv: These waited on the king, beside those whom the king put in the fenced cities throughout all Judah.

question: When the king of Syria commanded his captains, who were they told to fight against (1 Kings 22:31)?
explanation: 1 Kings 22:31 says the king of Syria commanded his captains not to fight with small or great, save only with the king of Israel.

verses.kjv: But the king of Syria commanded his thirty and two captains that had the rule over his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.

question: In the battle at Ai, what did Joshua stretch out toward the city (Joshua 8:18)?
choices: The spear that he had in his hand
explanation: Joshua 8:18 says the LORD told Joshua to stretch out the spear in his hand toward Ai, because the LORD would give it into his hand.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Stretch out the spear that is in thy hand toward Ai; for I will give it into thine hand. And Joshua stretched out the spear that he had in his hand toward the city.

question: After Ai was taken, how long did Joshua hold out the spear toward the city (Joshua 8:26)?
choices: Until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai
Until sunset on the first day only
For three days and three nights
Until the men of Israel returned to Gilgal
explanation: Joshua 8:26 says Joshua did not draw his hand back until all the inhabitants of Ai were utterly destroyed.

verses.kjv: For Joshua drew not his hand back, wherewith he stretched out the spear, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.

question: What did the LORD tell Israel to do with the spoils of Ai (Joshua 8:2)?
choices: Take the spoil and cattle for a prey unto yourselves
Bury the spoil outside the camp
explanation: Joshua 8:2 says Israel could take the spoil and cattle of Ai for themselves (unlike Jericho).

verses.kjv: And thou shalt do to Ai and her king as thou didst unto Jericho and her king: only the spoil thereof, and the cattle thereof, shall ye take for a prey unto yourselves: lay thee an ambush for the city behind it.

question: When David pursued the Amalekites, what did David do after inquiring of the LORD (1 Samuel 30:8)?
choices: He pursued, for he would surely overtake and recover all
He stayed in Ziklag and waited
He sent messengers to make peace
explanation: 1 Samuel 30:8 records the LORD’s answer: David should pursue, and he would surely overtake and recover all.

verses.kjv: And David enquired at the LORD, saying, Shall I pursue after this troop? shall I overtake them? And he answered him, Pursue: for thou shalt surely overtake them, and without fail recover all.

question: What happened to the Philistines when Jonathan and his armourbearer began to smite them (1 Samuel 14:15)?
choices: There was trembling in the host, and it became a very great trembling
They immediately surrendered with no fear
They were struck blind at once
explanation: 1 Samuel 14:15 says there was trembling in the camp, in the field, and among all the people, and the earth quaked, making it a very great trembling.

verses.kjv: And there was trembling in the host, in the field, and among all the people: the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled, and the earth quaked: so it was a very great trembling.

question: When Jehoshaphat’s people began to sing and praise, what did the LORD set against the enemies (2 Chronicles 20:22)?
explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:22 says the LORD set ambushments against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir when Judah began to sing and praise.

verses.kjv: And when they began to sing and to praise, the LORD set ambushments against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir, which were come against Judah; and they were smitten.

question: When Saul heard that David was brought to Gath, what did Saul do (1 Samuel 27:4)?
choices: He sought no more again for him
He sent an army to capture him
He made a covenant of peace with him
He offered him a place in his court
explanation: 1 Samuel 27:4 says that when Saul was told David had fled to Gath, Saul stopped seeking him.

verses.kjv: And it was told Saul that David was fled to Gath: and he sought no more again for him.
